subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype .
A complete shell and other elements, corresponding to the specimen 24 in
Hummel ( 1935 )
(fig. 23 in
Hummel, 1935
).

Referred material. Several partial shells, corresponding to the specimens 1, 18 , 24, 25 , and 39 in
Hummel ( 1935 )
(figs 24–28 in
Hummel, 1935
).
Type locality and horizon.
Mücheln, Germany (
Fig. 1
). Lutetian, MP 11–13 , middle Eocene (
Hummel, 1935
; de Lapparent de Broin, 2001 ). Emended diagnosis. A species of
Pelorochelon
with eight to nine neurals, which differs from
P. soriana
by: rectangular morphology of the third or fourth neurals; short sides posteriorly positioned in the hexagonal second and third neurals; long gular protrusion; relatively long epiplastral symphysis, being even longer than the entoplastron in some specimens; long dorsal epiplastral lip, longer than half of the length of the epiplastral symphysis; long medial region of the pectoral scutes, almost as long as the entoplastron, or even longer than this plate.
